preamble.longtitle: An Act to amend the definition of "sale by retail" in section 201 of the Licensing Act 1964; and for connected purposes.
preamble.enactment: Be it enacted by the Queen's most Excellent Majesty, by and with the advice and consent of the Lords Spiritual and Temporal, and Commons, in this present Parliament assembled, and by the authority of the same, as follows

leaf.margin: Amendment of definition of "sale by retail" in Licensing Act 1964.

content.leaf: Amendment of definition of "sale by retail" in Licensing Act 1964. In section 201 of the [1964 c. 26.] Licensing Act 1964 (interpretation), for the definition of "sale by retail" there shall be substituted—
Amendment of definition of "sale by retail" in Licensing Act 1964. .

Amendment of definition of "sale by retail" in Licensing Act 1964. In paragraph (e) above the expressions "beer", "case", "cider", "spirits", "wine" and "made-wine" have the same meaning as in the [1979 c. 4.] Alcoholic Liquor Duties Act 1979.

Repeal of section 181 of Licensing Act 1964. In consequence of section 1 of this Act, section 181 of the Licensing Act 1964 (which enables a wholesaler to sell by retail without a justices' licence in certain circumstances) is hereby repealed.
Further consequential repeals.The following enactments are hereby repealed—
Further consequential repeals.paragraph 16 of Schedule 7 to the [1967 c. 54.] Finance Act 1967;
Further consequential repeals.paragraph 5(3)(a) of Schedule 3 to the [1979 c. 4.] Alcoholic Liquor Duties Act 1979; and
Further consequential repeals.paragraph 24 of Schedule 8 to the [1981 c. 35.] Finance Act 1981.
Short title, commencement and extent.This Act may be cited as the Licensing (Retail Sales) Act 1988.
Short title, commencement and extent.This Act shall come into force on such day as the Secretary of State may appoint by order made by statutory instrument.
Short title, commencement and extent.This Act does not extend to Scotland or Northern Ireland.
